title.narrative: ENHANCED NATIONAL CAPACITY AND EVIDENCEGENERATION

description.narrative: The country has strengthened its capacity to implement gender-sensitive child-sensitive policies and procedures, and strategic stakeholders have more evidence on child protection issues., which contributes to Access To Justice, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, girls and boys, particularly the most vulnerable, benefit from a child protection system that effectively protects them from violence, abuse and exploitation, including in humanitarian situations

participating-org.narrative: C N I D H COMMISSION NATIONALE INDEPENDANTE DES DROITS DE L HOMME
CENTRE DE FORMATION PROFESSIONNEL DE LA JUSTICE
MINISTERE DE LA SOLIDARITE NATIONALE DES DROITS DE LA PERSONNE HUMAINE ET DU GENRE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The country has strengthened its capacity to implement gender-sensitive child-sensitive policies and procedures, and strategic stakeholders have more evidence on child protection issues.

description.narrative: In 2019, the revision of the National Child Protection Policy and the new National Child Protection code, developed with UNICEF technical assistance, were both submitted to the Council of Ministers for adoption and promulgation. Despite the delay in the development of a system to capture routine data, the child rights monitoring programme recorded 1,679 (1,167 boys and 512 girls) child protection cases that required attention and thus enabling relevant timely assistance to victims and witnesses. Five provinces have developed and implemented child protection action plans. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of laws and policies on child protection revised to be in line with international norms and standards
Country routinely collects and publishes key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex.
Percentage of districts that have an information management that is inter operable and supports and tracks case management, incident monitoring, and programme monitoring ( humanitarian)

Country has a national, multi-sectoral plan(s) or strategy(ies) for coordinated action to prevent and respond to violence against children that meets key criteria for quality, according to status of plan.
